articles.content:
Scientists have discovered a unique star flipping its polarity and blasting its radio wave beam in odd directions around 15,000 light-years away.

articles.title: ‘Like a rose flower’: How netizens reacted to NASA’s picture of a pulsar - The Indian Express
articles.description: SXP 1062 is a young pulsar in the remains of a supernova located in the Small Magellanic Cloud (SMC), a small satellite galaxy to the Milky Way
articles.content:
